search_parameters.q: John Lennon, age, music related skills + abilities + occupations, proficiency in each, and current residence location (city, state)

text_blocks.snippet: John Lennon passed away on December 8, 1980, at the age of 40. He was a globally renowned English musician, songwriter, and peace activist.
Lennon was a self-taught multi-instrumentalist whose skills were primarily focused on rhythm and songwriting rather than classical training.

list.snippet: Occupations: Musician, singer, songwriter, activist, author, and artist.
Songwriting: World-class; co-wrote 25 number-one singles on the Billboard Hot 100.
Vocals: Highly proficient; ranked the 5th-greatest singer of all time by Rolling Stone.
Rhythm Guitar: Highly skilled; described as a "quintessential rock rhythm player" known for innovative, complex chords.
Harmonica: Highly proficient; it was his first instrument, and he featured it prominently in early Beatles recordings.
Piano/Keyboards: Proficient for recording and composition; he composed his iconic solo hit "Imagine" on an upright piano.
Other Instruments: Played bass guitar, banjo, various percussion, and experimented with many others (lap steel, mellotron, saxophone) on studio recordings.
Last Current Residence: New York City, New York.
Specific Address: He lived in The Dakota apartment building located on the Upper West Side of Manhattan.
Resting Place: Following his death, he was cremated, and his ashes were scattered in Central Park, New York City, at the site of the Strawberry Fields memorial.

text_blocks.snippet: Would you like to explore more about his solo discography or his songwriting partnership with Paul McCartney?
